articles.author: Brad Brooks, Jorge Garcia, Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Hundreds of U.S. Marines arrived in Los Angeles overnight and more were expected on Tuesday under orders from President Donald Trump, who has also activated 4,000 National Guard troops to quell protests despite objections from California Governor Gavin Newsom and other local leaders.
articles.title: Marines arrive in LA under Trump orders as protests spread to other cities

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: A nine-minute-long Russian drone attack on Ukraine's second largest city of Kharkiv in the middle of the night killed at least two people and injured 54, including five children, regional officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Intense Russian drone attack on Kharkiv kills 2, injures 54, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The two Chinese aircraft carriers spotted conducting simultaneous operations in the Pacific for the first time send a political message about the country's "expansionist" aims, Taiwan Defence Minister Wellington Koo said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Chinese carriers in Pacific show country's 'expansionist' aims, Taiwan says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Talks between the United States and Russia on resolving issues in their bilateral relations will move to Moscow from Istanbul, Russia's new ambassador to Washington told the state TASS news agency.
articles.title: U.S.-Russian talks to take place in Moscow, Russian envoy says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Austrian police said on Wednesday that a pipe bomb was found at the home of the suspect in a school shooting on Tuesday in the city of Graz, but that it was not functional.
articles.title: Austrian police say non-functional pipe bomb found at suspect's home

articles.author: Kate Holton, Alistair Smout
articles.description: U.S. and Chinese officials agreed on a framework to put their trade truce back on track and resolve China's export restrictions on rare earth minerals and magnets, U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday at the conclusion of two days of intense negotiations in London.
articles.title: US, China reach framework deal to ease export restrictions

articles.author: Alan Charlish
articles.description: A vote of confidence in Poland's government will take place on Wednesday, as Prime Minister Donald Tusk seeks to regain the initiative for his ruling pro-European coalition after it was shaken by a presidential election defeat.
articles.title: Poland's Tusk seeks fresh start after presidential election blow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tobacco smugglers and black market salesmen are increasingly using technologies such as social media and drones to deliver cigarettes to smokers in Europe and avoid law enforcers, a report by consulting group KPMG published on Wednesday found.
articles.title: Criminals turn to drones and social media to sell illegal cigarettes

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli gunfire killed at least 17 Palestinians and wounded dozens as thousands of displaced people approached anaid distribution site run by a U.S.-backed humanitarian group in central Gaza on Tuesday, local health authorities said.
articles.title: Israeli gunfire kills 17 people near Gaza aid site, health officials say

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Russia launched another prolonged drone attack on Ukraine, killing one person and damaging swathes of Kyiv as well as striking a maternity ward in the southern port of Odesa, regional officials said early on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's latest drone strikes hit Kyiv, maternity ward in Odesa, Ukraine says
